Package it.polimi.ingsw.GameModel

Class TurnManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.GameModel.TurnManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class TurnManager extends Object implements Serializable
Class that manages the order in which players play their turn. This class determines planning order and action order in the Planning and Action phases of the game.
See Also:

      public List<Player> actionPlayerList

    • clockwisePlayerList

      private final List<Player> clockwisePlayerList
      Note: "clockwise order" here is the order in which Players choose their Wizard deck. The assignWizard function from Game will fill clockwisePlayerList little by little each time it is called.

  • Constructor Details

    • TurnManager

      public TurnManager()

  • Method Details

    • addPlayerClockwise

      public void addPlayerClockwise(Player player) throws NullPointerException
      Function that fills clockwisePlayerList one player by one. The assignWizard method from Game will call this method each time it is executed.
      Parameters:
      player - the new player introduced into the game room
      Throws:
      NullPointerException

    • determineRandomPlayer

      private Player determineRandomPlayer()
      Function that randomly selects the player who starts the game. They will be the first to choose their Assistant card in the planning phase of the very first round.

    • determinePlanningOrder

      public void determinePlanningOrder()

    • determineActionOrder

      public void determineActionOrder(Map<Player,AssistantCard> cardsPlayedThisRound)

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()

    • getCurrentOrder

      public List<String> getCurrentOrder()
      Returns current order
      Returns:
      a list of nicknames ordered

    • determineClockwiseOrder

      public void determineClockwiseOrder(Player startingPlayer) throws NoSuchElementException
      Method that sets the planning order clockwise starting from a given player.
      Parameters:
      startingPlayer - player from which to start the planning turn
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - the parameter startingPlayer is not a valid player inside the game

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn() throws IllegalStateException
      This method progresses the turn, updating currentPlayer.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException

    • nextPhase

      public void nextPhase()
      This method progresses the phase, going from planning to action and vice-versa.

      public Phase getCurrentPhase()
